jax_approx_step.description: Step for finite differences or complex step for Jacobian approximation

jac_approx_use_threading.description:
if True, use Threads instead of processes
 to parallelize the execution. 
Multiprocessing will serialize all the disciplines, 
while multithreading will share all the memory.
 This is important to note if you want to execute the same
  discipline multiple times, you shall use multiprocessing

jac_approx_wait_time.description: Time waited between two forks of the process or thread when using parallel jacobian approximations (parallel=True)

jac_approx_n_processes.description:
maximum number of processors or threads on 
which the jacobian approximation is performed
 by default, 1 means no parallel calculations

cache_type.description:
Type of cache to be used.  
By default, simple cache stores the last execution inputs and outputs  
in memory only to avoid computation of the outputs if the inputs are identical.
 To store more executions, use HDF5 caches, which stores data on the disk.
 There is a hashing mechanism which avoids reading on the disk for every calculation.

cache_tolerance.description:
Numerical tolerance on the relative norm of input vectors 
 to consider that two sets of inputs are equal, and that the outputs may therefore be returned from the cache without calculations.

cache_hdf_file.description: Path to the HDF5 file to store the cache data.

cache_hdf_node_name.description:
Name of the HDF dataset to store the discipline
 data. If None, the discipline name is used.
